school_context: Medium urban elementary school (500 students, 25 teachers)

software_licensing.assumptions: Based on premium ITS pricing of $10-$16 per student annually (500 students). Pricing from Carnegie Learning ($15/student), ASSISTments (free-$12/student for premium), DreamBox ($14/student).
software_licensing.data_source: Vendor pricing sheets (Carnegie Learning, DreamBox, Khan Academy Premium) as of 2024

implementation.assumptions: Higher implementation cost due to curriculum alignment requirements. IT setup (30-40 hours at $50/hr), rostering integration, curriculum mapping to standards. Assumes cloud-based deployment.
implementation.data_source: Industry estimates from EdTech implementation studies; Carnegie Learning implementation guides

training.assumptions: More intensive training required for ITS. Initial PD workshop (8-10 hours for 25 teachers) plus ongoing coaching. Substitute coverage ($5,000) + vendor training ($1,000-2,000). Some platforms require 10-15 hours initial training per teacher.
training.data_source: Carnegie Learning PD requirements; DreamBox training estimates; average substitute rates

maintenance.assumptions: Ongoing IT support (15-20 hours/year at $50/hr), content updates, dashboard monitoring, troubleshooting. Higher than basic tools due to curriculum integration.
maintenance.data_source: IT department budgeting estimates for adaptive learning platforms

benefits.additional_benefits_notes: Student outcomes: Effect size d=0.47-0.52 on standardized tests, with mathematics showing strongest effects (d=0.52). Meta-analysis shows 15-28% improvement in learning gains. ITS particularly effective for struggling students (d=0.82). Provides 24/7 personalized tutoring, freeing teachers for higher-order instruction and relationship building. Enables true differentiation at scale. Equity benefit: Closes achievement gaps for lower-achieving students with larger effect sizes.

payback_period_description: Payback in 1.5 months. Year 1 ROI of 720% ($147,600 benefits vs $18,000 total costs). Ongoing annual ROI of 1,936% ($147,600 benefits vs $7,250 recurring costs).
assumptions_and_caveats: ROI calculation uses teacher hourly rate of $40. Benefits assume 39% reduction in lesson planning time across 25 teachers (baseline 10.5 hrs/week for differentiated instruction). ITS implementation requires higher upfront investment in training and curriculum alignment compared to automated grading. Success highly dependent on implementation fidelity - meta-analyses show high variability across implementations. Does not quantify substantial student outcome improvements (d=0.47-0.52) in monetary terms. Time savings may vary significantly by teacher experience and subject area. Requires sustained use over time to realize full benefits.
